q: While Dermot O'Leary would love to continue working with Simon Cowell by taking a role on the US' X Factor' he is trying not to worry about it. He said: I'm keeping my head out of it. I want to do it but I'm being philosophical about it. If I get it that's fantastic and if I don't, I don't.

insisted that the referendum "shows that there is no possibility of ruling a factory without the consensus of the workers." Industry Minister Maurizio Sacconi predicted the decision would encourage investment in Italian industry. The outcome of the referendum opens an evolution in industrial relations, especially in large factories that should allow a better use of the plants and a real increase in salaries, Maurizio Sacconi told Italian state radio. Sergio Marchionne had pledged to link pay increases to productivity. But the flexible work rules also limit the right to strike during full production, and reduce break times and sick pay

We do not expect material changes to the strategy, and believe the company will be in capable hands under Larry Page , wrote UBS's Brian Pitz, who maintained his "Buy" rating on Google's stock and raised his price target from$ 735 to$ 780. Kirsten Gillibrand , D-N.Y., wrote to Secretary of State Hillary Clinton urging the administration to veto the move and make it clear to the Palestinian Authority that it needs to sit down in direct talks with Israel, rather than pursue unhelpful resolutions at the United Nations. that provide job training and prepare troops for the job market before leaving the military. Veterans returning home from Iraq and Afghanistan make up for some of the highest unemployment rates in the country. For the young veterans coming back from Iraq and Afghanistan, it's as high as 20 percent. We need to do better in terms of making opportunities to these veterans so that they can get jobs, good paying jobs, to provide for their families and start their own small businesses, Kirsten Gillibrand said.
